meanings.definition: Preserve (a body) by embalming and drying it.
meanings.sent1: The ancient Egyptians mummify bodies to keep them from decaying.
meanings.sent2: She mummifies fruits by drying them in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The chef jokingly mummifies the leftovers in the fridge to save them for later.
meanings.sent4: Time almost mummifies memories, preserving them in the recesses of our minds.
meanings.sent5: The desert heat mummifies the lizard, leaving it perfectly preserved.

meanings.definition: Preserve (something) by drying and wrapping it.
meanings.sent1: To keep the flowers fresh, she mummifies them in tissue paper.
meanings.sent2: He carefully mummifies the fragile artifacts to protect them from damage.
meanings.sent3: The child playfully mummifies his toys in blankets before bedtime.
meanings.sent4: The ancient civilization mummifies their sacred scrolls in linen for safekeeping.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist mummifies the delicate papyrus scrolls to prevent decay.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the fruit mummifies if left out in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The ancient pharaoh's body slowly mummifies in the dry desert air.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten sandwich in the lunchbox begins to mummify over the weekend.
meanings.sent4: As the years pass, the once vibrant leaves mummify into brittle remnants.
meanings.sent5: In the arid climate, the wooden statue starts to mummify, losing its original color.
